sentences.chinese: 有夷山，故曰夷陵，今硤州縣也，故城在今縣西北。
sentences.literal: There is Mount Yi, hence it is called Yiling; it is now Xiazhou County, with its ancient city northwest of the present county.)
sentences.idiomatic: The place takes its name from Mount Yi, hence 'Yiling'; it's now Xiazhou County, with its old city lying northwest of the modern county.)

sentences.literal: ) They all appointed generals and commanders, invading and plundering commanderies and counties.
sentences.idiomatic: ) Each set up their own leadership structure, raiding and seizing commanderies and counties.

sentences.chinese: 又別號諸賊銅馬、大肜、高湖、重連、鐵脛、大搶、尤來、上江、青犢、五校、檀郷、五幡、五樓、富平、獲索等，〈諸賊或以山川土地為名，或以軍容彊盛為號。
sentences.literal: Additionally, the various bandits were separately known as the Copper Horse, Great Vessel, High Lake, Heavy Link, Iron Shin, Great Robber, Especially Come, Upper Jiang, Green Calf, Five Schools, Tan Township, Five Banners, Five Towers, Rich Plain, and Obtain Rope groups. (The various bandits sometimes took names from mountains, rivers, and lands, or from their military appearance and strength.)
sentences.idiomatic: The bandits also went by various names: Copper Horse, Great Vessel, High Lake, Heavy Link, Iron Shin, Great Robber, Especially Come, Upper Jiang, Green Calf, Five Schools, Tan Township, Five Banners, Five Towers, Rich Plain, and Obtain Rope. (Some took their names from geographical features, others from their formidable military bearing.)

sentences.chinese: 銅馬賊帥東山荒禿、上淮況等，大肜渠帥樊重，尤來渠帥樊崇，五校賊帥高扈，檀郷賊帥董次仲，五樓賊帥張文，富平賊帥徐少，獲索賊帥古師郎等，並見東觀記。
sentences.literal: The Copper Horse bandit leaders were Dongshan Huangtu, Shang Huaikuang, and others; the Great Vessel leader was Fan Zhong; the Especially Come leader was Fan Chong; the Five Schools bandit leader was Gao Hu; the Tan Township bandit leader was Dong Cizhong; the Five Towers bandit leader was Zhang Wen; the Rich Plain bandit leader was Xu Shao; the Obtain Rope bandit leader was Gu Shilang; and others—all appear in the Dongguan Record.)
sentences.idiomatic: The leaders of the Copper Horse bandits included Dongshan Huangtu and Shang Huaikuang; Fan Zhong led the Great Vessel group; Fan Chong led Especially Come; Gao Hu led Five Schools; Dong Cizhong led Tan Township; Zhang Wen led Five Towers; Xu Shao led Rich Plain; Gu Shilang led Obtain Rope—and all these are recorded in the Dongguan Record.)

sentences.chinese: 〉各領部曲，〈《續漢志》曰：「大將軍營有五部，部三校尉。
sentences.literal: ) Each led their own buqu. (The Continued Book of Han states: 'The Grand General's camp has five bu, each bu has three colonels.')
sentences.idiomatic: ) Each commanded their own military units. (According to the Continued Book of Han: 'The Grand General's encampment consists of five divisions, each division having three colonels.')

sentences.literal: ) Their combined forces numbered several hundred thousand men, pillaging wherever they went.
sentences.idiomatic: ) Together they mustered several hundred thousand fighters, raiding and looting throughout the land.

sentences.chinese: 光武將擊之，先遣吳漢北發十郡兵。
sentences.literal: Guangwu was about to strike against them; he first sent Wu Han north to mobilize troops from ten commanderies.
sentences.idiomatic: Guangwu prepared to attack them, first dispatching Wu Han north to raise soldiers from ten commanderies.

sentences.chinese: 幽州牧苗曾不從，漢遂斬曾而發其衆。
sentences.literal: Youzhou Governor Miao Zeng refused to comply; Han then executed Zeng and mobilized his troops.
sentences.idiomatic: Governor Miao Zeng of Youzhou refused to obey; Wu Han had him executed and then raised his forces.

sentences.chinese: 秋，光武擊銅馬於鄡，〈縣名，屬鉅鹿郡，故城在今兾州鹿城縣東。
sentences.literal: In autumn, Guangwu attacked the Copper Horse bandits at Kuang. (Kuang is a county name, belonging to Julu Commandery; its ancient city is east of Luocheng County in present-day Jizhou.)
sentences.idiomatic: That autumn, Guangwu struck at the Copper Horse bandits near Kuang. (Kuang was a county in Julu Commandery; its old city lies east of Luocheng County in modern Jizhou.)

sentences.literal: The character 'Kuang' is pronounced according to the reverse fanqie of Ku and Yao.)
sentences.idiomatic: Kuang is pronounced with the sound of 'ku yao' reversed.)

sentences.chinese: 竹書紀年曰：「衞鞅封于鄡。」
sentences.literal: The Bamboo Annals states: 'Wei Yang was enfeoffed at Kuang.'')
sentences.idiomatic: According to the Bamboo Annals: 'Wei Yang received Kuang as his fief.'')

sentences.chinese: 臣賢案：下文云「吳漢將突騎來會清陽」，又「追至館陶」，並與鄡相近。
sentences.literal: Minister Xian's note: The text below mentions 'Wu Han led the shock cavalry to meet at Qingyang' and 'pursued to Guantao,' both of which are near Kuang.)
sentences.idiomatic: Comment by Minister Xian: Later passages mention Wu Han bringing his shock troops to rendezvous at Qingyang and pursuing the enemy to Guantao, both locations near Kuang.)

sentences.chinese: 俗本多誤作「鄔」，而蕭該音一古反，云屬太原郡，臧矜音作鄢，一建反，云屬襄陽郡，並誤也。
sentences.literal: Popular editions often mistakenly write it as 'Wu,' and Xiao Gai pronounces it 'yi gu' reversed, claiming it belongs to Taiyuan Commandery; Zang Jin pronounces it as 'Yan' with 'jian' reversed, claiming it belongs to Xiangyang Commandery—all are errors.)
sentences.idiomatic: Common printed versions frequently miswrite it as 'Wu,' with Xiao Gai giving it the pronunciation 'yi gu' reversed and claiming it belongs to Taiyuan Commandery, while Zang Jin pronounces it 'Yan' with 'jian' reversed and claims it's in Xiangyang Commandery—all incorrect.)

sentences.literal: ) Wu Han led the shock cavalry to rendezvous at Qingyang.)
sentences.idiomatic: ) Wu Han brought his elite cavalry to join forces at Qingyang.)
